alert.note: Alert for Childress; Cottle; Hall; King (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued February 27 at 2:10PM CST until February 28 at 8:00PM CST by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 11 AM TO 8 PM CST TUESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE EXTREME SOUTHEASTERN PANHANDLE AND THE EASTERN ROLLING PLAINS... The National Weather Service in Lubbock has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect from 11 AM to 8 PM CST Tuesday. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * Timing...11 am to 8 pm CST Tuesday. * Wind...West at 15 to 25 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * Humidity...8 to 13 percent. * Fuels...Dry. * Impacts...Any fires that develop can spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is discouraged.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
